ref: 2113 *unmathyatē ʻ is stirred up ʼ 2. unmathayati ʻ shakes, excites ʼ BhP. 3. *unmāthayati. [unmathnāti ʻ disturbs, rouses ʼ PārGr̥., mathyátē ʻ is stirred ʼ RV., māthayati MBh.: √manth]
Pk. ummacchia -- ʻ angry, bewildered ʼ, ˚cha -- n. ʻ anger ʼ, ˚chavia -- ʻ puffed up with pride ʼ;
G. (Sorath where ch > s) umas f. ʻ disgust, swoon ʼ;
M. umhās, ˚sā, umās, ˚sā m. ʻ rising of any strong emotion, heaving of the stomach ʼ.
